We are Sixsense Strategy Group (www.sixsenseinc.com), a boutique consulting company with a singular focus on the life sciences industry. Our strategists and scientists collaborate to provide a unique and refreshing approach to strategy. We work with a breadth of clients. Our sweetspot is companies that are launching new therapies or entering new disease areas and are looking for strategic partners.We have had the honour of working with a number of Canadian, US, and European-based pharmaceutical and biotech clients including, Apellis Pharmaceuticals, EMD Serono, Sage Therapeutics, Spark Therapeutics, Alnylam Pharmaceuticals, Arena Pharmaceuticals, Neurogene, Chiesi, Intercept, bluebird bio, Ovid, Jazz Pharma, Flexion Therapeutics, Sobi, Vertex Pharmaceuticals, and many others.ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for qualified and motivated individuals to join our Scientific Communications team in an entry-level research/writing role – Medical Communications Writer. Role responsibilities include:Conducting robust scientific research and literature reviewsInterpreting and synthesizing large amounts of scientific data/literature and communicating it in a client-friendly manner with an easy to follow narrativeSupporting the development of key scientific communications documents including – scientific platforms, lexicons, interactive internal training modules for client teams, posters, reports from Advisory Boards, etc.Developing simple scientific/medical graphics to communicate conceptsQualifications And SkillsAble to start working full time within 3 weeks of receiving an offerA comprehensive understanding of the life sciences with the ability to utilize this knowledge across different therapeutic areas. A Masters or higher in Life Sciences is required. (MSc., PhD., PharmD, etc.)Able to analyze and communicate (written and verbal) scientific information across different therapeutic areas at a level of detail for appropriate for the audienceExperience in the development of scientific/medical communications, publications, and posters. This extends beyond the development of publications that may be geared more to a high science audienceAble to work independently and as part of a project team to execute deliverables within stated timelinesProven writing/communication skills with high attention to detail - both in a narrative style for reports as well as PowerPoint presentationsExemplary organization and time management skillsProficiency in MS Office, excellence in PowerPointLegally able to work in CanadaAbility to legally travel outside CanadaSixsense Strategy Group offers an exciting, dynamic work environment. Starting on day one, you are a member of our highly-valued team of consultants, working in support of our client’s success. Your professional development will be on a steep curve as you work closely with our Senior Consultants in interesting therapeutic areas. Our onboarding process is designed to welcome and prepare you for success in our collaborative environment. In the first three months, we provide opportunities for regular check-ins with our managing partner and director, people, culture & operations to provide feedback, gather insights to your development and support growth. A mentor is assigned to each new hire to ensure a trusted resource is available for guidance and support.Sixsense offers competitive compensation, annual profit-sharing based on individual and company performance, a RRSP matching program, group health and dental benefits, travel insurance and more.Sixsense is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodations in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please advise us if you require an accommodation. We are a Herspiegel Company with operations in Canada and the United States.

Company: Venari Partners | Executive Search & Advisory Services
Job Description: Venari Partners has been retained by Bavarian Nordic, a fully integrated vaccine company focused on the development, manufacturing and commercialization of an expanding portfolio of life-saving vaccines. Bavarian Nordic is looking to boost its global commercial presence and launch into a number of new country markets. To this end, they are looking for an experienced Country Manager to spearhead the establishment and growth of their Canadian affiliate. This person would need to be someone highly entrepreneurial who is excited by the challenge to build a business from the ground up. They would need to boast an in-depth understanding of both the Vaccines space and the healthcare market within Canada. This person will have both full P&L responsibility for the affiliate and responsibility for overseeing a number of product launches over the next 12-24 months. Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute a comprehensive local sales strategy aligned with company’s overall business ambition.Lead commercial interactions with key distribution partners and liaise with global business development and Legal for alignment.Lead the country commercial team and provide direction, goal and results oriented leadership, change management and coaching.Provide direction to the marketing team to ensure delivery of business objectives and implement approved strategic / brand / promotional plans.Foster good relationships with external experts, customers, and with the government and ensure compliance with company, regulatory and local laws.Take accountability for local P&L. Deliver annual sales / profit targets. Exercise expenses control.Define tender strategy / ensure timely submissions of responses to tender bids (if applicable).Plan for successful launches of new assets. Ensures local life-cycle management.Drive on-going portfolio and therapeutic analysis that result in optimization of resource allocation.Liaise with the medical and regulatory department to coordinate registrations and amendments to already registered products.Gather information on market trends and competitor activities and analyses activities and market data and development of action plan.Provide matrix leadership to the various support functions.Ideal Candidate will have:Commercial / business education (master degree), degree in natural sciences, medicine or pharmaceutics or a comparable education, compliance with all local educational regulatory requirements.Local market knowledge within Canada.Vaccines experience is essential.Strong understanding of pharmaceutical industry, including regulatory requirements and market dynamics.Commercial acumen and proven track record of effectively managing resources and budgets. 10-12 years leadership experience.General finance and management skills, prior P&L management experience would be a distinct advantage.Sales & negotiation skills. Track record in consistently achieving / exceeding sales targets.Pioneering, entrepreneurial spirit and a high degree of ability to continuously adapt oneself and the team to special market conditions and to align ways of working accordingly.Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities to make evidence-based decisions.

Join us as we change healthcare for the better. OceanMD, a WELL Health Company, is the leading provider of EMR-integrated Patient Engagement and eReferral tools in Canada, playing a critical role in millions of patient visits and thousands of referrals every week. Our digital healthcare solutions empower patients and physicians to overcome the barriers preventing the timely delivery of healthcare services. By replacing paper forms with digital tools, we give patients and providers secure ways to connect, share health information, and update patient records. Our tools:Empower patients to share health information with their physician before, during, and after visits, helping to ensure health records are up to-date and accurate while improving patient care.Meet the growing demand for digital solutions with online booking and secure messaging that improves the patient’s experience, reduces the need for unnecessary phone calls, and makes clinics more efficient. Improve access to care by replacing faxes, displaying wait times, and reducing the time to process and access specialist referrals.  Who we needReporting to the Director, Government Program Services, we are adding a Project Manager to our team. In this newly created role, you will be critical in representing OceanMD and supporting provincial roll-outs of the Ocean Platform within the healthcare sector. You will execute plans to align and drive project deliverables, mitigate risks, define proactive resolutions, and ensure an exceptional implementation experience for our clients.This is a hybrid role requiring work in-office 1-2 days per week and travel across Canada as needed.Who you areYou are passionate about the opportunity to improve the healthcare industry. You are looking for that rare opportunity that combines digital or e-health, bridges the private and public sectors, and impacts the clinical and patient care level. You have strong project management skills, ideally leading complex change initiatives in healthcare environments such as hospitals, government, or the private sector. You thrive in an environment where no two days are alike, navigating the rapid pace with ease. You are comfortable in the face of ambiguity and embrace change as an integral part of the journey.What's in it for youImpact and influence. You want to make a difference in how Canadians experience the healthcare system and empower patients and physicians with the technology they need to streamline access to information. A place to grow your career and your skills. You will immerse yourself in learning about what we do, understanding the impact we make on the lives of Canadians - established and new, young and old - as we bring an empowering service to them. We are looking for individuals who want to commit to our work, take our offerings to the next level and beyond, and help us grow as a company. In turn, as we continue to scale, we will take you on the journey with us, with opportunities for professional development, recognition, and growth.How you will make an impactProject manage. You will lead and implement large-scale healthcare technology solution projects with multiple stakeholders. You will define goals and track progress, manage resource allocation, scope creep, change management and communications, and track progress toward completing deliverables on time, within scope, and within budget.Communicate and measure. You will foster highly effective working relationships with stakeholders at all levels, keeping them informed on the progress of projects and managing conflicts effectively and diplomatically to ensure that issues are addressed and resolved promptly to minimize disruption.Manage risk. You will proactively identify project risks and recommend solutions and mitigation strategies to ensure project success.Collaborate. You will promote a culture of collaboration within the team and across multiple stakeholders, managing conflicts effectively and diplomatically to ensure that issues are addressed and resolved promptly to minimize disruption.Relationship management. You will build a reputation as a trusted advisor, influencing decision-makers, managing expectations, and ensuring clients are satisfied at every stage.What you bringThe project management expertise. You have proven successful experience as a Project Manager, leading teams to deliver complex, cross-functional projects from end to end, ideally in the healthcare sector. Ideally, you have implemented or been part of an EMR implementation previously. Bonus points if you have your PMP designation.The interpersonal skills. You can influence without authority and work in partnership with teams, managers, and executives. You have effective professional written, verbal, and presentation skills. You are highly collaborative and genuinely interested in understanding others, hearing their perspectives, addressing their concerns, resolving conflict, removing roadblocks, and encouraging high-quality results.The organizational skills. You are adept in managing documentation and project tracking within a fast-paced environment. You have strong organizational skills with the ability to manage documentation and project tracking in a fast-paced environment. Your strengths include maintaining open communication and updates on progress, identifying roadblocks, and helping your team overcome barriers. You think creatively and have an analytical approach to problem-solving, task, and time management. You can work alongside other project managers, following and contributing to best practices.The adaptability. You work with a sense of urgency and enthusiasm, thrive in an evolving environment and step up to different daily challenges. You have the confidence to take new ideas forward and productively challenge the status quo.The technical skills. You are proficient in MS Office, including strengths in building presentation decks in PowerPoint that succinctly convey results and provide data-based recommendations. Experience with the Ocean platform would also be an asset. The passion. You are passionate about our purpose and applying your talents to build our brand. You are interested in new ideas and new technology.What you can expect from our interview process:A virtual interview with a Talent Advisor discussing your interest in the role and the company and how you will make an impact as our new Project Manager.A virtual interview with the Director, Government Program Services and the COO to learn about the role and future plans. You will be able to share your insights and expertise and have time to ask questions about the company and the role.A final in-person interview with members of the Government Program Services team and the leadership team. This will be a chance for you to ask questions about the company’s growth trajectory and how you will play a key role as the new Project Manager.Our culture, our teamWe’re a scaling company expanding rapidly across the country. We are incredibly passionate about our ability to make a difference in the lives of Canadians through our technology, and we firmly believe that we can do our best work with realistic deadlines and transparent communication about where we are and what’s next for us as an organization. We understand the time it takes to revolutionize a paper-based industry and develop and release high-quality, resilient, compliant, and responsive technology that is easy to use, so we ensure that pace is factored into our projects and deliverables across the organization. Our focus is your growth and professional satisfaction, resulting in clear opportunities to help us scale and be better through your ideas and the chance to be part of projects and try new things. We are dedicated to our team, and we strongly believe that family comes first. To that end, we strive to find opportunities to support balance in the workplace and between work and home. As part of this, we have flexible hours, regular opportunities for social get-togethers, and meeting-free Friday afternoons. Everyone here is deeply committed to what we can do - and the potential we have to do more. As a result, we provide an opportunity for Cognisant Causes, our name for passion projects in healthcare, where no funding is available and a little technical expertise and time is needed to make a big difference. It’s a way to give back and to add further meaning to what you do here. A note on valuesWe value ethical behaviour above all else. We care about each other, and we respect each other as professionals and people. We treat our customers with respect and keep our word, even if it hurts. We own our mistakes. We strive for honesty and integrity every day in every situation. We look for people who share these values.We are transforming patient care across the country, and we’ve only just begun. Join usWe are always on the lookout for ethically driven, intelligent, and compassionate professionals who want to be part of an energetic culture and company, people who are interested in contributing their talents in a challenging, interdisciplinary environment. If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications we are looking for and are determined to make a difference, we encourage you to apply. We promise to consider your application fully. Express your interest here, explore what we do here, or follow us on LinkedIn to stay connected.We strive to build a diverse team and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please let us know.#LI-Hybrid

About The Ottawa HospitalInspired by research and driven by compassion!The Ottawa Hospital (TOH) is one of Canada's largest learning and research multi-campus hospitals. With more than 1,100 beds and approximately 12,000 staff members, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region.From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges while continually engaging with the community to support our vision for better patient care.Working together with its research institute, the University of Ottawa, and other partners, the hospital is continually gaining national and international recognition for high-quality patient care, teaching and research, while striving to meet the needs of the culturally diverse community we serve.Job Posting InformationPlease note that this salary is under review, and in the interim the salary range above include a Temporary Market Premium.Position Information The Director, Quality and Patient Safety will provide leadership and guidance in the effective delivery of services in alignment with the established mission, vision, values, and policies of TOH. This critical role is responsible for departmental oversight of the Quality and Patient Safety Team and overseas the strategic direction in the development, implementation, and evaluation of quality management systems for The Ottawa Hospital.The Director will act as a key liaison for internal/external stakeholders, will provide expertise and consultation to ensure engagement, compliance, and understanding of TOH’s strategic objectives and priorities. The incumbent will lead and support process changes to enable The Ottawa Hospitals to spread the capability and capacity for quality improvement across the hospital.This position has the accountability for the design and maintenance of the Quality Management System at TOH, which includes the Just Culture System/framework, patient safety identification, policy and procedure document control, internal quality and patient safety audit program, coordination of hospital accreditation, quality improvement methods, and the annual Quality Improvement Plan.The Director, Quality and Patient Safety ensures that safety, learning, and accountability systems are used and applied consistent with a just culture, and that their leaders are closing the loop on inspections/audits, incidents, risk assessments and other staff and patient safety issues, to ensure continuous quality improvement.Rotation/ShiftsDays, 8 hours shiftsWhat you will doThe Director, Quality and Patient Safety is accountability for the design and maintenance of our Quality Management System at The Ottawa Hospital (TOH). This includes the following key aspects:Cultural aspects (focus on quality and patient safety)Accountability for the implementation and maintenance of the Just Culture framework and philosophy at TOH – to maintain an ongoing focus on safety and continuous improvement.Quality Assurance aspects (second line of defense efforts)Accountability for the implementation and maintenance of patient safety identification (risk event reporting, analysis and effective follow-up)Accountability for the implementation and maintenance of the TOH Document Control (policy and procedure) management process.Accountability for the implementation and maintenance of the TOH internal quality and patient safety audit programAccountability for coordination of the hospital Accreditation processQuality Improvement MethodsAccountable for developing, providing, educating and maintaining problem-solving methods and tools to staff and physicians for assessing and improving quality and patient safety across TOHStrategic quality planningAccountable for leading the creation and submission of the annual Quality Improvement Plan. This position also has accountability for ensuring the implementation and maintenance of appropriate IS/IT systems to support TOH’s Quality Management Systems.What you will bringMaster’s degree of Science in Healthcare Quality or Health Administration or Quality Improvement and Patient Safety or related field;Professional certifications in quality and patient safety;Minimum ten (10) years of quality and patient safety experience, preferably in a healthcare setting;Minimum five (5) years of progressive leadership experience managing a team;Experience leading process/quality improvement initiatives to drive organizational performance;Experience supporting safe and high quality patient care through multidisciplinary quality improvement processes incorporating interdisciplinary standards of care, accreditation standards, and management of patient safety concerns. ,Ability to lead and motivate people to embrace the quality improvement philosophyDemonstrated knowledge, expertise and experience in diverse stakeholder engagement and effectively leading change within a large and complex organization,;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills required to effectively handle complex/sensitive issues ;Strong organizational and time-management skill and ability to provide direction to others in managing competing priorities and balancing multiple tasks with often unpredictable and short deadlines;Demonstrated experience in health quality and patient safety methods, approaches and tools;Ability to create and sustain a culture of service excellence that consistently focuses on the needs of internal and external clients and patients;Experience with process improvement methodologies.You will stand outProficiency in English and French – oral expression (advanced level) and comprehensionlevel);Individuals with clinical healthcare experience in addition to the above qualifications will be strongly preferred.Interested? Apply today!If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by improving the health of the community, excited by leading-edge medical technology, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient safety as we are, we would like to hear from you. Please submit an on-line application for the position you are interested in.Please submit your application for Job ID# 99215 via our Careers page. We thank all those who apply but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.The Ottawa Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the recruitment process.

Are you looking to join one of Greater Toronto’s Top 2024 Employers?The Ontario Medical Association (OMA) advocates for and supports doctors, seeking to strengthen their leadership role in caring for patients. We continually seek to be the trusted voice in transforming Ontario’s health-care system by courageously pursuing best practices, new ideas, solutions, and opportunities to improve.Job SummaryThis position is responsible for managing the Section Engagement team’s activities related to planning, organizing and supporting groups of elected physician leaders in the assigned Primary Care Network (PCN). This includes leading a team that develops an in-depth understanding of member issues and priorities, managing issues that require escalation, and identifying opportunities for alignment with the work of the OMA for leaders in the PCN. This role acts as a main point of contact between the Section of General and Family Practice (SGFP) and the OMA and works with senior staff across departments to support the work of the Section and the Primary Care Network.How You Will Make a DifferenceCoaching, managing and guiding staff to navigate and resolve issues and ensure the sections of physician leaders in the Primary Care Network (PCN) receive a consistent and high level of support.Managing the day-to-day work of the team that supports section physician leaders in the PCN with planning and organizing section work and builds strong relationships with the leaders.Working with senior staff across OMA departments to support the work of Sections in the Network and flag issues/opportunities.Managing the relationship with the SGFP and act as a conduit between the Section and the OMA.Developing an in depth understanding of key member issues and opportunities for alignment with the work of the OMA.Acting as subject matter expert regarding OMA policy positions, legal and financial issues, products, services, etc. to support and drive engagement through informing and supporting the SGFP.Working with Sr. Director to support a high functioning Network structure where constituencies collaborate, discuss issues and share resources.Providing Secretariat support for the Primary Care Network and following up on action items from Network meetings.Liaising and coordinating activities with other OMA departments and physicians to ensure an effective and integrated flow of information to support physician leaders.Working with Sr. Director to identify budget requirements, develop annual operating budgets, forecasts etc. for the Section Engagement team and for assigned constituencies, where required.Requirements That Are Important To UsUndergraduate Degree in Health Science, Political Science or equivalent. Six to nine years of relevant healthcare administration, public speaking, and political acuity experience.Experience working in Ontario’s health care sector and/or a member-based association sector is preferred.Strong relationship management and stakeholder engagement skills.In-depth knowledge of primary care and the issues primary care physicians face across the health care system.Ability to build and manage relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.Experience in the research, development and drafting of regulations, bylaws, policies, and guidelines.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong organizational, analytical, and decision-making skills.Demonstrated experience and skills with people leadership, including ability to lead a diverse team through change and manage expectations.Supports the organization’s commitment to respect equity, inclusion, diversity, and anti-racism.The OMA has moved to a permanent hybrid work environment. As such, the individual in this position will be required to work a minimum number of days in our Toronto office.What do we have to offer you?A work environment whose values are to be respectful, bold, responsive, and transparent in our work and our behavioursA fantastic opportunity to grow with the team and help shape the strategic direction of the OMA, its members and the health-care systemAn organization that is committed to the equity, diversity and inclusion principles of humility, accountability, collaboration, courage and integrityA commitment to growth and development through paid professional development and continuous in-house learningA friendly and flexible hybrid work environmentCompetitive salary and bonus programExceptional group benefits package, including a spending account and a robust wellness programAn organization that has been recognized as a Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for four consecutive years.As a condition of employment, OMA conducts background checks and reference checks for all open positions.Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube | LinkedIn­­The Ontario Medical Association is strongly committed to diversity within its community and welcomes applications from racialized persons/persons of colour, women, Indigenous People of North America, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. In accordance with the AODA Act, accommodation will be provided throughout the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities.

Who we areWELL is an innovative technology-enabled healthcare company whose overarching objective is to positively impact health outcomes by leveraging technology to empower and support healthcare practitioners and their patients.WELL's practitioner enablement platform includes comprehensive end-to-end practice management tools, including virtual care and digital patient engagement capabilities, Electronic Medical Records (EMR), data protection services, and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) through our DoctorCare solution. WELL owns and operates Canada's largest network of outpatient medical clinics serving primary and specialized healthcare services and is the provider of a leading multi-national, multi-disciplinary telehealth offering. The opportunityWELL Health Billing and Back Office Division, including DoctorCare, Doctors Services Group, Secure Solutions, and more, is disrupting how billing services are delivered to doctors across Canada. Our solutions streamline operations, decrease costs, and keep processes up-to-date. We take the administrative burden of complex medical billing off doctors’ plates, enabling them to focus on what really matters: cutting wait times and improving the delivery of care and the patient experience. We are looking for a people leader to join us as a Manager of Operations, Medical Billing on a maternity leave contract. Reporting to the Director of Client Success, you will guide and support the work of a team of medical billing experts based in Burlington and Rockwood, Ontario. You will take ownership of operations to ensure efficiency and outstanding client satisfaction through innovative service offerings and streamlined processes.Who you are You are an insightful leader who demonstrates and applauds initiative and accountability. You believe in fostering a positive, growth-oriented culture where colleagues support each other and work towards accomplishing the greater company mission. Whether you have a management background in retail, hospitality, banking, startups or directly in healthcare this is the purpose-driven role to consider.This hybrid opportunity requires the flexibility to work alongside teams in Burlington, and Rockwood, and attend regular meetings in Toronto up to 2 times a month. What’s in it for you Purpose. We are a mission-driven organization where everyone is focused on making a difference. You will make a measurable impact on our healthcare system, supporting a team delivering a high-value service to our client base. Autonomy and influence. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing portfolio of companies solving complex problems in healthcare with innovative technology and exceptional service. You will draw on your experience and insights as well as the expertise of our client success and strategy leaders to introduce best practices and processes. You will:Lead a team. You will direct and mentor a dedicated team of medical billing experts, ensuring we have the systems and processes in place to exceed client expectations. You will nurture and grow your team, building out recruitment, onboarding, training, professional development, and performance management plans. You will conduct individual and team meetings regularly, increasing trust and communication.Manage daily operations. You will oversee the billing department, including medical coding, claims submissions, error reconciliation, payment posting and accounts receivable follow-up. You will monitor and manage business KPIs, team SLAs, and client satisfaction, targeting robust NPS and retention goals. Optimize. You will identify gaps and implement tools and best practices. You will work with other designated senior team members to design, document and deploy processes that improve, align, and expedite our work.Prioritize client engagement. You will foster relationships with clients and grow your industry expertise to identify opportunities for increasing service offerings. You will work closely with the Sales team to provide a smooth and responsive onboarding.Support. You will liaise with relevant healthcare departments, such as the Ministry of Health, for client inquiry investigations and escalations. You will stay up-to-date on healthcare policies and their impacts on our business and clients.Continuously improve. You will create an environment that encourages idea-sharing. You will regularly reassess and optimize service delivery, always seeking better, more efficient ways to serve our clients. You will actively listen to clients and team members to collect and apply valuable feedback and recommend service enhancements to senior leadership.Here's what you bring:The motivation. You want to channel your experience and your natural leadership and problem-solving energy into a new, in-demand industry, healthcare technology. The leadership. You have proven success in a management role, overseeing a team, building customer relationships, managing P&L, resources, and deliverables, and meeting quarterly and annual performance or revenue goals. You are passionate about team development, process improvement, customer success and bringing it all together. You can gain trust and respect to build collaborative relationships. You have professional and flexible communication skills. You stay calm under pressure, can overcome objections, and manage conflict. The growth mindset. You are smart and humble, and you continuously seek new knowledge to expand your thinking, support others, and solve problems. You operate with the highest degree of integrity, acknowledge and learn from mistakes, and look for ways to improve.The technical skills. You believe in leveraging technology to introduce efficiency. You can come up to speed on new tools, including Electronic Medical Records (EMR) software, Salesforce, and JIRA or another project management tool. You are proficient with Microsoft Office.The flexibility. You can travel as needed to Burlington, Rockwood, and Toronto.Why join us?Healthcare is our sector, and we know that for WELL to be a winning team, we must provide an open environment to prioritize health and wellbeing and multiple resources to discuss mental, physical, and psychological needs openly. From the CEO to the newest hire, everyone comes together as part of our culture of respect, openness, support, and communication. We unite to empower each other to be the best we can be.We recognize that the best way to serve our diverse patient communities is by reflecting that diversity. With almost 65% of our team members identifying as female and 70% of our leadership identifying as a visible minority, we are proud of our diverse, equitable and inclusive organization.Interested in applying but worried you don't have it all? At WELL, we know not everyone gains their experience following a traditional path. If you share our values, want to make a difference in healthcare technology solutions, and meet 70% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply. Express your interest here.WELL is committed to supporting a diverse, inclusive, and accessible workplace. We welcome and celebrate the diversity of applicants and team members across ability, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, and perspective. We strive to create an inclusive workplace where differences are celebrated and fuel our success – this is the WELL Way! Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.#LI-Hybrid

English version below Chef de projet En tant qu'acteur clé de l'industrie radiopharmaceutique, Jubilant Radiopharma s'engage à repousser les limites de la science et de la technologie pour répondre aux besoins médicaux non satisfaits et fournir des solutions de médecine de précision. Nos installations de pointe, nos capacités de recherche de classe mondiale et notre engagement inébranlable en matière de qualité et de conformité font de nous un partenaire de confiance pour les prestataires de soins de santé, les chercheurs et les patients du monde entier.Êtes-vous prêt à faire passer vos compétences en gestion de projet au niveau supérieur ? Nous recherchons un chef de projet talentueux et expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe et diriger des projets interfonctionnels dans l'industrie pharmaceutique et des dispositifs médicaux. En tant que chef de projet, directement rattaché au directeur de la gestion des projets mondiaux de R&D, vous aurez l'occasion de travailler avec des outils et des méthodologies Agile de pointe pour mener des projets de la conception au lancement. Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?  Des projets passionnants : Gérer des projets en plusieurs phases, y compris le pré-développement, le développement, le dépôt, l'approbation et le lancement, en veillant à ce que les résultats soient satisfaisants à chaque étape.  Environnement agile : Utiliser les pratiques et les outils Agile/Scrum pour collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles, en veillant à l'alignement, à la visibilité et à la responsabilité.  Rôle de leadership : Diriger des équipes de projet pluridisciplinaires en assurant la direction, la coordination et le soutien du lancement, de la planification, de l'exécution, du suivi et de la clôture des projets.  Impact stratégique : Assurer la liaison entre les équipes internes, les parties prenantes externes et les différents CMO, en favorisant la réussite des projets et les objectifs de l'organisation.  Développement professionnel : Prenez en charge des projets complexes, développez des relations solides et améliorez vos compétences en leadership dans un environnement en constante évolution.  Responsabilités :  Diriger des réunions d'évaluation de projet interfonctionnelles afin de clarifier le champ d'application du projet.  Guider et encadrer les équipes sur les pratiques Agile/Scrum, y compris scrumban, sprint, burndown, et les outils Agile.  Effectuer une analyse financière mensuelle du budget prévu par rapport au budget réel du projet et rendre compte des écarts.  Diriger les réunions stand-up, les revues, les rétrospectives, les démonstrations et autres réunions liées à scrum.  Gérer les produits livrables du projet, la portée, le budget, le calendrier et les attentes du client.  Créer, communiquer et suivre la structure de travail du projet, les listes de tâches, le calendrier et le chemin critique.  Faciliter la communication interfonctionnelle, la prise de décision et l'alignement avec les parties prenantes.  Contrôler l'avancement du projet, évaluer les besoins permanents et ajuster les plans du projet si nécessaire.  Communiquer les informations pertinentes sur le projet et les mises à jour de l'état d'avancement à la direction générale et aux principales parties prenantes.  Résoudre et/ou faire remonter les problèmes/risques selon les besoins, afin de garantir la réussite du projet et d'atténuer les risques potentiels.  Qualifications :  Diplôme universitaire en sciences ou en ingénierie.  Une certification Agile SCRUM et une certification en gestion de projet (PMP) sont des atouts majeurs.  2 à 3 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire dans l'industrie pharmaceutique ou des dispositifs médicaux.  Maîtrise des outils Agile, de Smartsheets et des outils Microsoft Office.  Solides compétences en matière de leadership, de communication et de résolution de problèmes.  Connaissance préalable des affaires réglementaires, du contrôle de la qualité et des tâches liées à la chaîne d'approvisionnement.  Expérience du développement de médicaments, de la fabrication et des exigences réglementaires.  Réflexion stratégique, compétences analytiques et capacité à gérer la pression dans un environnement en constante évolution. Si vous êtes une personne proactive, axée sur les résultats, passionnée par la gestion de projets et désireuse de faire la différence dans l'industrie pharmaceutique et des dispositifs médicaux, nous voulons vous connaître ! Rejoignez notre équipe et franchissez une nouvelle étape dans votre carrière. Postulez dès maintenant pour devenir notre prochain chef de projet ! Project Manager As a key player in the radiopharmaceutical industry, Jubilant Radiopharma is committed to pushing the boundaries of science and technology to address unmet medical needs and deliver precision medicine solutions. Our state-of-the-art facilities, world-class research capabilities, and unwavering commitment to quality and compliance make us a trusted partner for healthcare providers, researchers, and patients worldwide.Are you ready to take your project management skills to the next level? We're seeking a talented and experienced Project Manager to join our team and lead cross-functional projects in the pharmaceutical and medical device industry. As a Project Manager reporting directly to the Director of R&D Global Project Management, you'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge Agile tools and methodologies to drive projects from conception to launch. Why Join Us?  Exciting Projects: Manage projects in multiple phases, including pre-development, development, filing, approval, and launch, ensuring successful outcomes at each stage.  Agile Environment: Utilize Agile/Scrum practices and tools to collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment, visibility, and accountability.  Leadership Role: Lead multidisciplinary project teams, providing direction, coordination, and support for project initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure.  Strategic Impact: Act as a key liaison between internal teams, external stakeholders, and various CMOs, driving project success and organizational goals.  Professional Growth: Take charge of complex projects, develop strong relationships, and enhance your leadership skills in a fast-paced environment.  Your Responsibilities:  Lead cross-functional Project Evaluation meetings to ensure project scope clarification.  Guide and coach teams on Agile/Scrum practices, including scrumban, sprint, burndown, and Agile tools.  Conduct monthly financial analysis of planned versus actual project budget, reporting on variances.  Lead stand-up meetings, reviews, retrospectives, demos, and other scrum-related meetings.  Manage project deliverables, scope, budget, timeline, and client expectations.  Create, communicate, and track project WBS, task lists, timeline, and critical path.  Facilitate cross-functional communication, decision-making, and alignment with stakeholders.  Monitor project progress, assess ongoing needs, and adjust project plans as necessary.  Communicate relevant project information and status updates to Senior Management and key stakeholders.  Resolve and/or escalate issues/risks as required, ensuring project success and mitigating potential risks.  Qualifications We're Looking For:  University degree in Sciences or Engineering discipline.  Agile SCRUM certification and Project Management Certification (PMP) are strong assets.  2-3 years of experience in a similar position in the pharmaceutical/medical device industry.  Proficiency in Agile tools, Smartsheets, and Microsoft Office tools.  Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.  Previous knowledge of Regulatory Affairs, Quality Control, and supply chain tasks.  Experience with drug development, manufacturing, and regulatory requirements.  Strategic thinking, analytical skills, and ability to handle pressure in a fast-paced environment. If you're a proactive, results-driven individual with a passion for project management and a desire to make a difference in the pharmaceutical and medical device industry, we want to hear from you! Join our team and take the next step in your career journey. Apply now to become our next Project Manager!

We are seeking a dedicated HR Assistant to join our team. The HR Assistant, will play a crucial role in maintaining accurate HR files and records, answering employee inquiries, assisting with payroll, recruitment, and new hire orientation, and supporting the implementation of company programs to increase morale. The ideal candidate will have completed post-secondary education in Human Resources, possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and have a detail-oriented and organized approach to their work.Responsibilities:· Maintains accurate & up to date human resources files, records, and documentation.· Answers frequently asked questions from employees relating to standard policies, benefirs, etc.; refers to more complex questions to HRBP.· Maintains the integrity and confidentiality of HR Files and records.· Performs periodic audits of HR files & records to ensure that all required documents have been collected & filed appropriately.· Assists with payroll functions such as processing, answering employee questions, and fixing processing errors.· Assists with recruitment.· Conducts new hire orientation.· Support in implementing company programs to increase morale.· Entering data into HR databases· Tracking the attendance of employees and their use of vacation and sick days· Other duties as assigned by the HRBP.

Company Description BioPed Footcare has been providing custom made orthotics and foot care solutions for over 40 years across Canada. With 65 locations, our highly trained Certified Canadian Pedorthists assess, design, and manufacture custom made orthotics in our on-site labs, allowing fast turnaround times and immediate adjustments. We also provide fashionable orthotic friendly footwear, footwear modifications, compression stockings, OTC braces and custom knee braces. Our goal is to create a “total patient care experience” by providing customized and complete foot and lower limb care solutions. Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a Patient Care Coordinator at BioPed Footcare located in Toronto, ON. The Patient Care Coordinator will be responsible for appointment scheduling, phone etiquette, care coordination, patient care, and knowledge of medical terminology. Qualifications Appointment scheduling and phone etiquette skillsExperience in care coordination and patient careKnowledge of medical terminologyExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize multiple tasksBachelor's degree in Health Sciences, Nursing or equivalent is an assetExperience in the healthcare industry is an asset

About Klick HealthMeet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!About Klick ConsultingKlick Consulting works alongside clients and their businesses to improve patient outcomes in healthcare by providing innovation and digital guidance to global clients operating across health, including pharmaceuticals, medical devices and biotech. Headquartered in Toronto, the team is made up of experts in a variety of disciplines, from business strategy to behavioral science to AI/ML.It’s an exciting time to join Klick Consulting. Health organizations are facing an increasingly complex business landscape that’s changing at an accelerated pace. New technologies are emerging rapidly, government regulations are shifting, the face of competition is changing, and the workforce is more dynamic and empowered than ever. Klick Consulting prides itself on helping clients navigate their problems by taking them from strategy to solution, often testing our results in the market.You can learn more about the Klick Consulting team here: https://consulting.klick.com/If you are open to freelance opportunities working with the Klick Consulting team, please feel free to submit your resume and someone will be in touch if there is a suitable opportunity.As a freelance Consultant on the Klick Consulting team, you will be responsible for:Gathering external researchParticipating in customer and expert interviewsAnalyzing client and research dataCommunicating critical insights visually and verballyMaintaining deep knowledge of your projects and analysisCollaborating with team members across a range of disciplinesEngaging directly with a variety of clients ranging from privately held businesses to publicly traded multi-national corporationsExperience:At least 3+ years’ experience in a consulting environment is a must with a focus on healthcare, technology or dataPost-graduate degree such as an MBA, MPH or MSc or equivalent vocational experience is an assetExperience in primary and secondary research and data gatheringExperience in gaining alignment or gathering requirements through client workshopsExperience in design thinking and future thinking/fore sighting is an assetComfort in leading and participating in co-creational ideation and design exercisesExperience in scoping and project planningExcellent communication skills and high level of comfort presenting ideas,Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.

Our goals are to increase patient satisfaction, improve provider work life, improve population health, and reduce health care costs. CPH is a Network Lead Organization for the Ontario Structured Psychotherapy Program (OSP). OSP provides access to publicly funded, evidence-based, short-term, cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) and related approaches to clients with depression and/or anxiety (including obsessive compulsive concerns, trauma, social anxiety). What is this role?CarePoint Health is seeking a Digital Health Lead to manage and optimize technology solutions to improve the efficiency, quality, and accessibility of health care services delivery by and through CarePoint Health. The Digital Health Lead will also be responsible for change management and adoption of new digital health tools across the organization and the Ontario Structured Psychotherapy network. This is an exciting opportunity to join an innovative primary care team and regional mental health program. This is an ideal role for a candidate with a passion for maximizing digital tools to improve health outcomes. compliance.·      Demonstrated success in implementing digital health initiatives.·      Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills.·      Knowledge and experience with Votre rôle à titre de coordinateur des soins de nuit et soirDialogue est à la recherche d’un(e) coordinateur(-trice) des soins de nuit et soir pour contribuer à sa mission d’aider les gens à améliorer leur bien-être. En étroite collaboration avec Émilie Deschênes, chef de l’équipe de coordinateurs des soins, votre rôle a pour mission d'être le principal point de contact pour nos patients durant le soir et la nuit. Vous souhaitez rejoindre notre équipe multidisciplinaire exceptionnelle dans un secteur en pleine évolution? Bonne nouvelle, nous avons une place pour vous!Vos Responsabilités InclurontReprésenter le premier point de contact entre le patient et l’équipe médicale Assurer la liaison entre les équipes de soutien médical et technique afin d'aider les patients et les fournisseurs à résoudre divers problèmes médicaux, techniques ou logistiques Gérer les crises, surveiller les opérations pendant la nuit et fournir un soutien technique Trouver la meilleure ressource pour le patient afin de livrer une expérience mémorable S’engager à garantir une satisfaction totale du clientNous aimerions beaucoup vous rencontrer si vous possédez :Baccalauréat (préférablement dans un domaine de la santé) Traits de personnalité : autonomie, souci du détail, instigateur, attitude positiveDisponible pour travailler en équipe de nuit (généralement de 22h30 à 7h) et en soirée, en semaine et le week-end, dans le cadre de la rotation des horaires de notre équipe de nuit Excellentes compétences en communicationCapacité à gérer des crises et résoudre des problèmes rapidement dans le calmeExpérience professionnelle dans le système de soins de santé public et/ou travail de nuit (un atout) Le désir de travailler dans un environnement qui encourage l’autonomie, la patience et l’empathie Motivé par un milieu de travail dynamique, axé sur l'expérience patient Attiré par un environnement innovateur Facilité avec les outils informatiquesVeuillez noter qu'étant donné que nous servons des client(e)s situé(e)s dans tout le Canada, il est essentiel d'être bilingue pour ce poste. Vous pourriez être amené(e) à communiquer en français et en anglais.Chez Dialogue, votre bien-être est notre priorité.On ne peut pas prendre soin des autres, sans aussi prendre soin de notre équipe. Nous nous occupons de vous!Un régime d’avantages sociaux entièrement financé pour nos employé(e)s à temps partiel (21 heures ou plus) et à temps pleinUn accès illimité aux programmes de Dialogue pour vous et votre famille immédiate4 semaines de vacances, 9 journées de bien-être et 1 journée de bénévolat payée pour nos employé(e)s à temps pleinUne équipe de personnes brillantes, travailleuses et attentionnées pour favoriser votre croissance!À propos de DialogueDialogue est le principal fournisseur de soins virtuels au Canada. Nous avons aidé plus de 48 000 organisations à améliorer leur bien-être grâce à notre Plateforme de santé intégrée, qui offre un large éventail de programmes, notamment de soins primaires, de santé mentale, de bien-être et un Programme d’aide aux employé(e)s (PAE). Découvrez la véritable nature des Soins humains grâce à notre équipe qui vous guidera à chaque étape du processus.Nous vous acceptons comme vous êtes. En tant qu’employeur soucieux de l’égalité des chances, Dialogue s’engage à créer un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif pour tout le monde. Les personnes qualifiées qui poseront leur candidature seront considérées sans égard à la citoyenneté, l’origine ethnique, la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’identité ou l’expression sexuelle, l’orientation sexuelle, le handicap, l’âge ou le statut de vétéran. Les personnes qui ont besoin d’aménagements spéciaux sont invitées à nous écrire à l’adresse accessibility@dialogue.co.

Nouvelle opportunité ! ClinicalMind est une société de communications médicales à service complet avec une vaste expérience dans les domaines thérapeutiques spécialisés. Nous offrons des initiatives uniques et de pointe en direct et numériques conçues pour intégrer, soutenir et améliorer les objectifs de nos clients et stimuler un engagement supplémentaire avec des clients clés.L'équipe talentueuse de ClinicalMind définit notre entreprise. Quiconque travaille dans ce domaine sait que son succès repose sur une chose par-dessus tout : les gens. Joignez-vous à une agence de communication médicale en pleine croissance !Résumé du posteL'écrivain médical développe du contenu médical et scientifique pour les programmes de formation à utiliser dans les industries pharmaceutiques et des dispositifs médicaux. connaissance pratique du françaisSolides compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnellesCapacité de respecter les délais et multitâcheÀ l'aise de travailler dans un environnement collaboratif au rythme rapideCompétences en informatique : Microsoft Office (intermédiaire ou avancé)ActifsConnaissances ou formation formelle en rédaction médicale ou scientifiqueExpérience antérieure en rédaction médicaleConnaissance des principes de conception pédagogiqueExpérience d'enseignementConnaissance du guide de style AMAConnaissance de l'industrie pharmaceutiqueAppartenance à une association d'écritureExpérience dans l'écriture multimédiaEnglish TranslationNew opportunity! ClinicalMind is a full-service medical communications company with extensive experience in specialty therapeutic areas. We offer unique, cutting-edge live and digital initiatives designed to integrate, support, and enhance our client objectives and drive additional engagement with key customers.ClinicalMind’s talented team defines our company. Anyone who works in this business knows that their success is based on one thing above all else – the people. Come join a growing medical communications agency!Job SummaryThe Medical Writer develops medical and scientific content for training programs to be used in the pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Collaborating under the direction of a Medical Strategist, the project content is developed and referenced according to the project specifications and in partnership with other departments.Job ResponsibilitiesThe Medical Writer writes medical, scientific, and strategic training program content in collaboration with the project’s Strategist:Researches literature and client materials to distill medical/scientific information in a well-organized and grammatically correct mannerReferences written content according to internal SOPs and client specifications while ensuring accuracy, scientific validity, and relevanceEnsures that content follows client specifications and fulfills the training need as outlined in project mandateUses appropriate tone and language to align to medical/legal/regulatory (MLR) standards of the industry for complianceCollaborates with Graphic Artists to produce visuals to complement written copy and partners with Developers and/or Graphics Artists to write storyboards for various interactive media (eLearning, videos, etc)Works with all team members and departments to produce a uniform projectAssists in carrying out various duties as requested by Content managementJob QualificationsGraduate degree in Medical/Life Sciences field or equivalent (eg, Bio-Medical field)Minimum of 1 year of related experienceOutstanding proficiency in English (both written and oral); working knowledge of FrenchStrong communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to meet deadlines and multitaskComfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environmentComputer skills: Microsoft Office (intermediate or advanced)AssetsKnowledge or formal training in medical or scientific writingPrior experience in medical writingKnowledge of Instructional Design principlesTeaching experienceKnowledge of AMA style guideKnowledge of the pharmaceutical industryMembership in a writing associationExperience in multimedia writing

Job role: Wellbeing Leaders - Multiple Positions Throughout Manitoba
Job Description: Requisition ID: 354299Position Number: Multiple PositionsPosting End Date: Open Until FilledCity: Flexible in ManitobaEmployer: Shared HealthSite:  Within Assigned RegionDepartment / Unit: Wellbeing Centre of ExpertiseJob Stream: Non-ClinicalUnion: ExemptAnticipated Start Date: To Be NegotiatedFTE: 1.0Anticipated Shift: DaysWork Arrangement: In PersonDaily Hours Worked: 7.75Annual Base Hours: 2015Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient- centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations. Wellbeing Leaders will be situated within the geographic area of their assigned regional health authority (RHA) or service delivery organization (SDO). Office locations will be determined upon hire.  Roles in Prairie Mountain Health and Shared Health (Winnipeg) will offer some flexibility in part-time vs. full-time. Roles in Northern Health Region, Southern Health - Santé-Sud, Interlake-Eastern RHA, and Winnipeg RHA are full-time roles. Please include a cover letter and clearly state which RHA/SDO(s) you are applying to: Shared Health (Winnipeg) Winnipeg RHA Northern Health Region Interlake-Eastern RHA Prairie Mountain Health Southern Health-Santé Sud Position OverviewThis is an exciting time for Manitoba health care. Manitoba’s health system is currently in transition with changes aimed at improving the quality, accessibility and efficiency of health care services throughout Manitoba.As part of the Shared Health Workforce team, the Wellbeing Center of Expertise will develop, implement and evaluate a multi-year “made in Manitoba” provincial workplace wellbeing strategy to instill a holistic culture of wellbeing, psychological safety, belonging, equity, and meaningful connection through five inter-dependent pillars: People First, Instill Belonging, Foster Purpose, Inspiring Leaders, and Intentional Organizational Action.MAIN FUNCTIONReporting to the Manager, Provincial Wellbeing, the Wellbeing Leader will be instrumental in supporting the development and implementation of wellbeing initiatives, prevention strategies, and policies that will promote the holistic wellbeing of the healthcare workforce. The goal of these initiatives will be to build provincial capacity in responding to crisis, promoting recovery, fostering awareness of mental health supports, and enabling wellbeing along a continuum. As part of a provincial team and within the designated service delivery organization, the incumbent will serve as a role model and change agent for the organizational culture and vision of workplace wellbeing by leading day-to-day activities that support the provincial wellbeing strategy, including providing psychological supports, education, and training to the healthcare workforce. A key component of this role will be to support the implementation and delivery of a Critical Incident Stress Response Program across a full continuum of services. The incumbent will work collaboratively with various stakeholders including Service Delivery Organizations, Occupational and Environmental Safety & Health (OESH), Shared Health, Manitoba Health, and other health providers.ExperienceMinimum of 5 years' experience working in the healthcare delivery system and/or in a directly related role in healthcare.Previous clinical experience and training in providing trauma informed, systemic, strength-based approaches, and experience in providing the full continuum of Critical Incident Stress Response in both a group and individual setting.Strong clinical knowledge of mental health interventions, trauma, workplace stress, operational stress injuries, psychological safety in the workplace, and mental health and wellbeing.Experience and knowledge with the delivery of services and programs that foster equity, diversity, inclusion.Experience and demonstrated sensitivity in collaborating with Indigenous Peoples and culturally diverse populations.Experience with providing psychological supports to individuals and groups, both in person and virtually. Familiarity with Manitoba’s public health care system and services.Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)Bachelor’s degree in a health-related field (e.g., Psychology, Social Work, Nursing, Public Health, Health Sciences or a related field).A combination of relevant experience and education may be considered.Certification/Licensure/RegistrationActive member in good standing of an associated regulatory body as appropriate.A valid Manitoba driver’s license and use of a personal motor vehicle is required.Qualifications And SkillsIntermediate skills in MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint and virtual platforms (i.e. Microsoft Teams) required.Strong clinical skills including consultation, assessment, Critical Incident Stress Response, and trauma-informed care.Strong knowledge of associated evidence-based best practices and advanced training in Critical Incident Stress Response (CISR) including mental health, trauma, and CISR response and support systems.Strong coaching and facilitation skills including development and delivery of training to professional audiences and commitment to the recruitment, growth, and development of a regional peer support network.Demonstrated ability to implement and manage programs within the healthcare system, including the development of supporting documents, processes, procedures, and policies.Demonstrated effectiveness in change management, with an ability to lead and influence interdisciplinary healthcare professionals at all levels.Strong and compassionate people leadership skills with the ability to facilitate and negotiate using consultative decision-making processes, foster trust, maintain positive working relationships, and encourage diverse perspectives.Strong understanding of the value and importance of cross-team collaboration with the ability to act as a consultative partner with various stakeholders.Ability to exercise high level clinical practice, empathy, and sound judgement in relation to sensitive and confidential matters and information.Ability to work with front line employees with diverse life experiences with a demonstrated understanding of the impacts of marginalization on wellbeing.Ability to conceptualize systemically the multi-faceted and dynamic nature of wellbeing within the broader healthcare ecosystem.Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize as well as be adaptable to changing priorities as necessary.Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with diverse stakeholders at all levels.Competence in an Indigenous language and/or knowledge/lived experience in Indigenous customs, traditions, and values is an asset.Will be required to complete cultural safety training, including specific Indigenous cultural awareness training, required by the employer.Fluency in English and bilingualism in French an asset.The provincial health system in Manitoba has adopted the LEADS in a Caring Environment framework.Physical RequirementsMay be required to work safely in a typical computerized office environment with frequent meetings.May be required to travel throughout the service area requiring a valid Manitoba driver’s license and use of a personal motor vehicle.Some evening/weekend work may be required. We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.Interested candidates should select the "Apply" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification. This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment. Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

necessary care, resources, and coverage for gender-affirming procedures Fertility Services and Surrogacy Medical Coverage to support the pursuit of a path to parenthood regardless of medical responsibilitiesPromoting a positive company culture that values integrity, inclusion, collaboration, communication and teamworkMUST be able to multitask easily without compromising performance or attitudeJob Requirements:MINIMUM 2 YEARS OF MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCEExceptional customer service abilitiesHighly motivatedSolution-orientedKeen attention to detailProfessional communication and conflict-resolution skillsA positive and professional demeanorCompletely dependableMust be skilled with computers, able to adapt to new technology, learn new programs quicklyKnowledge of the services Territory: Eastern OntarioAdvance performance, transform livesAs part of a dynamic and growing organization, you'll thrive in an inspiring work culture that values and recognizes the results you achieve. Join Mölnlycke to shape your career while making a meaningful difference in the healthcare sectorMolnlycke is hiring an Area Sales Manager in Eastern Ontario! Join our dynamic team where your clinical expertise will help to implement our strategic sales vision and make a meaningful impact on patient care. Your role is more than just meeting sales targets; it's about using your clinical background to identify and cultivate new business opportunities by:  Capitalizing on your established relationships within the medical community to maximize sales growth and establish long-term, sustainable partnerships.  Immersing yourself in the heart of patient-focused care by ensuring complete and comprehensive sales and service coverage in the territory. Your ability to articulate complex medical concepts will shine through in presentations and in-service deliveries, enhancing our interactions with healthcare professionals and ultimately improving patient outcomes.  Your clinical insights will be a game-changer in securing new business or defending existing relationships in non-key accounts.  Crafting and presenting compelling commercial offers that resonate with the healthcare community, showcasing the value of our products and services.  Utilizing the "Global Sales Process" with finesse, aligning it seamlessly with your clinical expertise. By doing so, you'll drive the successful implementationof sales projects, ensuring positive and timely closures that align with our mission and objectives  Additionally, you’ll:  Showcase product value in patient pathways, reimbursement, and contracting models.  Manage the complete MHC wound care assortment for a sustainable and profitable business.  Plan and implement value-added solutions with customers to address needs and opportunities.  Maintain updated customer data and report activities in the CRM system.  Implement the "Global Sales Process" (3C Selling) for effective sales project management and goal achievement  Work/Life Balance  30 – 40% Overnights  What you’ll need:  A degree in life sciences, business management or equivalent proven experience in Healthcare environment  Previous healthcare / clinical experience  Recent local market and customer knowledge is an advantage  Good understanding of the challenges within the Health Care environment and how to navigate through all channels of the continuum of care  Highly self-motivated, adapts to change, flexible, manages priorities & team player  Comprehensive presentation and training skills  Strong interpersonal skills with ability to interact with a diverse group of individuals.  Our approach to diversity and inclusion At Molnlycke, diversity is not just a vision, but our strength. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace that values and celebrates the power of diversity. At the heart of our commitment is the belief that diversity fuels innovation, creativity, and problem-solving. We invite you to be a part of a team where authenticity is embraced and every employee, regardless of background or any other traits, experiences a true sense of belonging. Your attitude, drive, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn are just as important to us as the requirements for the role.About MölnlyckeMölnlycke is a world-leading medical products and solutions company that equips healthcare professionals to achieve the best patient, clinical and economic outcomes.Our business is organized into four business areas: Wound Care, Operating Room Solutions, Gloves and Antiseptics. Customer centricity, sustainability, and digitalization are at the heart of everything we do.Mölnlycke employs around 8,400 people. The company headquarters are in Gothenburg, Sweden and we operate in more than 100 countries worldwide. Since 2007, the company has been part of Investor AB, an engaged owner of high-quality, global companies which was founded by the Wallenberg family in 1916. For more information, please visit www.molnlycke.com and www.molnlycke.com/careersJoin our dynamic team where your clinical expertise transforms into a powerful force in the world of sales! As a key player in our sales force, you will not only implement our strategic vision but also leverage your profound medical knowledge to create meaningful connections and drive results.

and preparing reports.Exceptional communication, problem-solving and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and external stakeholders.Extensive information technology background in using Google WorkspaceFamiliarity with electronic health record (EHR) systems and web-based tracking systems is an asset.Knowledge of privacy regulations and experience handling confidential information.Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.An empathetic and compassionate approach to dealing with clients and their families.To apply, please email your resume and cover letter as a single PDF document to hr@mcdowallhealth.com by March 29, 2024, at 5:00 PM, quoting File #24-AXAdmin in the email “Subject” line.McDowall Integrative Psychology
